title: Important Historical Works on Animal Magnetism
first_phrase: In the previous text, several works exploring the concept of animal magnetism were presented, from the 18th to the 19th century. This last 200 tokens part focuses on another interesting perspective. It is a letter from J.-P.-F. Deleuze, addressed to the members of the Academy of Medicine in 1826, in which he discusses the importance of public opinion regarding the reality of animal magnetism. The letter offers insights into the scientific mindset of the time and the debates around the topic.
content: les membres de l'Académie de médecine, sur la marche qu'il convient de suivre pour fixer l'opinion publique relativement à la réalité du magnétisme animal... / par J.-P.-F. last_phrase: In conclusion, these historical documents provide valuable insights into the discovery and study of animal magnetism, which had a significant impact on the development of hypnotism and neuroscience. While some of the claims made by early practitioners may have been unfounded, the study of these phenomena paved the way for groundbreaking research in the field of psychology and medicine.
